page.text: E: kennyparkbc@gmail.com ㆍ M: 617-775-8544 ㆍ 116 lake St. Brighton, MA, USA 02135
A recent graduate in Economics and equipped with a strong academic background in accounting through pursuing independent studies in 13
different accounting courses. With a growing interest in accounting, I have passed AUDIT & ATTESTATION section within a CPA exam.
My past internship experiences in 3 different industries including accounting, private equity fund, and financial services ascertained my firm
career interest in accounting. As a squad leader during my two years of military service with Republic of Korea Army, I have turned into a
person who is easily adaptable to new environment, possesses a strong sense of responsibility with optimistic mindset and an excellent
communication skill
Boston College – Morrissey College of Arts and Sciences August 2008 – December 2015
Bachelor of Arts, Economics Chestnut Hill, MA
SAT score: 2040
Worcester Academy August 2004 – May 2008
 Honor Roll Worcester, MA
Ernst & Young Global Limited June 2015 – July 2015
Intern, Transaction Advisory Service Seoul, Korea
 Conducted extensive research on cellular network, mobile phone market and mobile platforms as part of a Purchase Price
Allocation engagement with LG Electronics to provide a valuation on its potential investment in acquiring a Polish IT company
that develops Radio Frequency Circuit chips for mobile platforms
 Participated in a Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) engagement of a Vietnamese company with Dongwon F & B Co, a Korean food
company, ranging from attending a conference call and documenting meeting minutes accordingly in Korean to performing
multiple footing tasks to ensure financial information provided by the client is free from error
 Supported another M&A engagement of an Ecuadorian company with POSCO, a Korea steel company, by examining and
reviewing Stock Purchase Agreement and relevant documents to identify outstanding requirements or clause on indemnification
when selling a remaining portion of the outstanding stocks
Stonebridge Capital June 2013 – August 2013
Intern, Private Equity Fund Division Seoul, Korea
 Conducted research on potential investment in Myanmar power plants through studying general information about the country, its
electricity market condition, two cases of oversea expansion by Korean companies, associated risks, and a trend of Foreign Direct
Investment of nine countries; presented results to senior management for analyzing pros and cons of the investment
 Presented profitability of an investment in steel cord to senior management, based on research on market size, supply and demand
trends, market pricing of raw materials and financial statement analysis
 Accumulated information on an investment portfolio of the competitors and recent articles regarding their operational and financial
status, in which assisted preparing for $ 1 billion funding project
Company September 2010 – June 2012
Republic of Korea Army (ROFK) Yeoncheon, Korea

text.i: Squad Leader, Stock Control Clerk, Ammunition Inspector

page.text:  Represented 30 engineers on active duty; enhanced the quality of military lives by corresponding to issues and suggestions brought
up during the Squad Leader meeting held with the Company Commander on a weekly basis
 Inspected the quantity and quality of military supplies and equipment by conducting physical counting; updated the perpetual
records of supplies inflow and outflow; reported any misplacement and breakage to the upper division on monthly basis
 Assigned to control approximately 100 different types of ammunition including trinitrotoluene, and grenades located within the
base and distributed live ammunition to all fellow engineers for the military exercises
Franklin Templeton Investments June 2009 – July 2009
Intern, Bond Division Seoul, Korea
 Examined the operating level of the bond team within the firm by conducting interviews with employees; contributed by
accumulating different data results from the survey of the bond team performance by employees in the bond team; evaluated
noticeable differences and presented the results to senior managers
 Researched on current macroeconomics related issues by using Bloomberg and provided senior managers with collected data that
are applicable when carrying out our project
World Vision Community Service July 2015
Volunteer Seoul, Korea
 Prepared lunch for 150 people including children from families under government assistance and elders without fixed income
 Presented by the Company Commander to top five soldiers in the company for outstanding performance and exemplifying
excellent discipline among fellow engineers
 Microsoft Offices Suite(Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Native Korean, fluent in English; educated in Spanish and Mandarin Chinese
